xxl.core.relational.tuples
Class Tuples

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.relational.tuples.Tuples

public class Tuples
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains various useful static methods for Tuples.

This class cannot be instantiated.

Method Detail

getTupleFactory

public MetaDataFunction<java.lang.Object,Tuple,java.sql.ResultSetMetaData> getTupleFactory(ColumnMetaData... metadata)
Returns a metadata function with the given metadata that takes lists of objects and returns tuples.

Parameters:
metadata - the relational metadata of the constructed tuples.
Returns:
a metadata function with the given metadata that takes lists of objects and returns tuples.

getTupleComparator

public static java.util.Comparator<Tuple> getTupleComparator(int[] columns1,
                                                             int[] columns2,
                                                             boolean[] ascending,
                                                             int[] caseInsensiveStringorderingColumns)
Returns a comparator that compares two tuples of different type according to a subset of column indices.

The comparison uses a lexicographical ordering of the column objects. The objects themselves have to be comparable, otherwise a ClassCastException will be thrown. The comparison can be processed in ascending or descending order.

Parameters:
columns1 - an array of column indices of the first type of tuple: the first column is 1, the second is 2, ...
columns2 - an array of column indices of the second type of tuple: the first column is 1, the second is 2, ...
ascending - an array of boolean values that determines the order (ascending=true/descending=false) for each dimension.
caseInsensiveStringorderingColumns - determines string columns that are compared using a case insensitive ordering. These indices have to be chosen according to the first type of tuple. If a string column is not listed here, the comparison is case sensitive. It is convenient to use the method ResultSetMetaDatas.getStringColumns(java.sql.ResultSetMetaData).
Returns:
a comparator that compares two tuples of different type according to a subset of column indices.

getTupleComparator

public static java.util.Comparator<Tuple> getTupleComparator(int[] columns1,
                                                             int[] columns2,
                                                             boolean[] ascending)

getTupleComparator

public static java.util.Comparator<Tuple> getTupleComparator(int[] columns,
                                                             boolean[] ascending,
                                                             int[] caseInsensiveStringorderingColumns)
Returns a comparator that compares two tuples of the same type according to a subset of column indices.

The comparison uses a lexicographical ordering of the column objects. The objects themselves have to be comparable, otherwise a ClassCastException will be thrown. The comparison can be processed in ascending or descending order.

Parameters:
columns - an array of column indices of the tuple: the first column is 1, the second is 2, ...
ascending - an array of boolean values that determines the order (ascending=true/descending=false) for each dimension.
caseInsensiveStringorderingColumns - determines string columns that are compared using a case insensitive ordering. These indices have to be chosen according to the first type of tuple. If a string column is not listed here, the comparison is case sensitive. It is convenient to use the method ResultSetMetaDatas.getStringColumns(java.sql.ResultSetMetaData).
Returns:
a comparator that compares two tuples of different type according to a subset of column indices.

getObjectFunction

public static Function<Tuple,java.lang.Object> getObjectFunction(int columnIndex)
Returns a function that accesses a column of a tuple parameter.

The function domains: 

Tuple --> Object (column)

Parameters:
columnIndex - index of the column: the first column is 1, the second is 2, ...
Returns:
the function that accesses the columns.

mapObjectsToTuples

public static Cursor<Tuple> mapObjectsToTuples(Cursor<? extends java.lang.Object> cursor)
Maps the elements of the input cursor to array-tuples.

Parameters:
cursor - the input cursor delivering the objects.
Returns:
a cursor containing the tuples.
